festival.introText:
Lytham Festival has become Lancashire’s Largest and best-loved Live Music Festival, attracting people in their thousands from all over the UK to enjoy awesome nights of Live Music & Arts by the Seaside.

Since it began in 2009, curated by Friends and Business Partners Daniel Cuffe and Peter Taylor, Lytham Festival has attracted super-star artists like Tom Jones, Bryan Adams, Noel Gallagher’s High Flying Birds, Faithless, Rita Ora, Michael Ball and so many more!

Children Under 16 years:

Under 16s must be accompanied by an adult aged 18 and over who has their own ticket. Children aged 2 and under can attend for free and don’t require a ticket. All other children must have a full price ticket to enter the concert.

reviews.title: Review of Lytham Festival 2022 Part 2
reviews.body:
Great venue if itâs the right music 
Love Lytham 
I look fallwards to Lytham festival 
It needs a tweak on the food and drink 
Excessive prices and the choice on the beer was poor 
Food overhaul was poor 
I think more seating required for the general public and tables would make the experience much better 
It would be nice to get to choose what bands you would like to see also hunk there should be different rock night

reviews.title: Review of Lytham Festival 2019
reviews.body:
Poor beer choice, queues too long at the bar.
Lovely staff on in the box office

reviews.title: Review of Lytham Festival 2019
reviews.body: Brilliant venue music amazing definitely going next year

reviews.title: Review of Lytham Festival 2019
reviews.body: Excellent night apart from extremely poor, expensive food and wine prices

reviews.title: Review of Lytham Festival 2018
reviews.body: Overpriced food and drinks, expensive tickets for a short event of just a few hours.

reviewsDisplayFour.body: Brilliant venue music amazing definitely going next year

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Lytham Festival 2019
reviewsDisplayFour.body: Excellent night apart from extremely poor, expensive food and wine prices

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Lytham Festival 2018
reviewsDisplayFour.body: Nyle rodger s and chic fantastic pkus soul to soul brill ..fantastic night all round

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Lytham Festival 2018
reviewsDisplayFour.body: OMG what a night it was at lytham festival watching il divo.they were absolutely fabulous and played for approx 2 and a half hours. the tickets were a great price at £35.the venue itself was lovely and clean.plenty of toilet cubicles.the prices of food and drink were very reasonable

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Lytham Festival 2018
reviewsDisplayFour.body: Fab event. Love it. Well worth the money.

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Lytham Festival 2018
reviewsDisplayFour.body: Great night I will be going again

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Lytham Festival 2018
reviewsDisplayFour.body: Been 2 years running now and still love it  look forward to next year

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Lytham Festival
reviewsDisplayFour.body: Hi to tell you the truth I was very disappointed with the outcome I originally booked in order to see Human League who to my dismay didn't perform.  I am hoping that nothing too serious has happened to any of the band members but would like a refund of my ticket and would like to know how to make a complaint thank you for your anticipated input in advance

reviewsDisplayFour.title: Review of Lytham Festival
reviewsDisplayFour.body: Fantastic evening at 80s 90s event be back next year

news.title: Lytham Festival announces second set of dates
news.summary: Lytham Festival will return in 2022 with a bumper lineup over two weekends and a mixture of fine talents and legends.

news.title: Lytham Festival tickets on sale today
news.summary: George Ezra, Pete Tong, Chic, Nile Rodgers Basement Jaxx, Il Divo and Steps confirmed. Find out how to get Lytham Festival tickets.

news.title: Lytham Festival releases 2017 line up
news.summary: A bumper crop of headline acts, including Olly Murs, Human League, Hacienda Classical and more hit Lytham St Annes between Wednesday 2nd August and Sunday 6th August.
